page.title: 03Farming in the Rochford Area
page.content: The largest farm in the area is Keddie's Farm. It is mainly a dairy farm, although they grow a few arable crops to feed the cattle. They have 170 cows altogether and are milking approximately 120 cows. Another interesting farm is Blatches Farm which is situated alongside a heavily populated area. At Blatches Farm they concentrate on growing crops that they can sell to the public on a "Pick Your Own" basis. They grow gooseberries, raspberries, strawberries, rhubarb, runner beans etc. The other farms are Honeypots Farm, Hawkwell Hall Farm and Cherry Orchard and Doggetts Farm. Cherry Orchard is mainly an arable farm where they grow wheat, although they are experimenting at the moment with one field of evening primrose which is used pharmaceutically.
